name: Stack Overflow
description: People realized that they could simply ask a bot their question and that it always had an answer.
hope: Turns out the answer is sometimes completely wrong.

name: Sharing a playlist with your crush
description: That guy was cute, but to be honest his music taste was meh. Spotify knows me better than anyone and every song on my Discover Weekly hits the spot!
hope: It's a shame I can't date Spotify.

name: Doctors
description: If making a diagnosis is mostly based on previous experience, then it might eventually become hard to beat models that eat petabytes of data for breakfast.
hope: That being said, "House A.I." sounds like the most boring show yet to be produced.

name: Illustrators
description: Let's be honest: DALL-E, Stable Diffusion and Midjourney can create some pretty amazing illustrations.
hope: But until they start sneakily hiding penises in their creations, can we really call that Art?

name: Writers
description: If you're writing for humans, you're probably safe. If you're writing to please some algorithms, there's a chance one of them will do better.

name: Asking a stranger for directions
description: "Hey Siri. Is it possible that this person knows a better way to X than you?"
hope: "Unlikely. But why don't you give it a try? Maybe dispersion will understand your accent better than I do..."

name: Recognizing the song that's playing and sounding cool
description: It's on the tip of your tongue! You're going to remem... too late! Someone pulled out Shazam and you just missed your chance.
hope: Next time this happens, shout some nonsense. Loudly. Make sure to not only find the song name but also an explanation for your behavior.
